node.title: University of Otago orientation events cancelled due to Covid settings
node.description: The Otago University Students' Association has cancelled large events planned for Orientation Week in February.
node.content:
["The Otago University Students' Association has cancelled large events planned for Orientation Week in February.", "", "
\nPhoto: RNZ / Nate McKinnon\n
", "The association made the announcement yesterday evening.", "\"Planning is underway for ORI '22 events in line with Government guidelines, under the appropriate Covid-19 Traffic Light setting. Keep watching for all updated information,\" the association said in a post on social media.", "At red light restrictions, gatherings are limited to 100 people with vaccine passes.", "The cancelled events included a concert by Belgian DJ Netsky, the annual toga party and the Food Truck Festival.", "All tickets will be refunded in the coming days.", "The University of Otago has implemented a vaccine mandate requiring all those on campus and in university halls of residence to have two doses of the vaccine, apart from those with a genuine medical exemption."]
